001package com.randomnoun.common.webapp.taglib;
002
003/* (c) 2013 randomnoun. All Rights Reserved. This work is licensed under a
004 * BSD Simplified License. (http://www.randomnoun.com/bsd-simplified.html)
005 */
006
007import java.io.*;
008
009import javax.servlet.http.*;
010import javax.servlet.jsp.*;
011import javax.servlet.jsp.tagext.*;
012
013import org.apache.log4j.Logger;
014
015
016/**
017 * Custom JSP tag which is used to ensure that the page was generated from within struts.
018 * This is used to prevent users from typing in JSP URLs directly, bypassing
019 * our security mechanisms.
020 *
021 * @author  knoxg
022 * 
023 */
024public class AuthCheckTag
025    extends BodyTagSupport
026{
027
028        /** Generated serialVersionUID */
029    private static final long serialVersionUID = -6531003975186503397L;
030
031        /** Logger instance for this class */
032    private static Logger logger = Logger.getLogger(AuthCheckTag.class);
033
034    /** This variable is set true if the request comes from struts */
035    private boolean isStruts;
036
037    /** doStart tag handler required to fulfill the Tag interface defined in the
038     * <a href="http://java.sun.com/products/jsp/">JSP specification</a>.
039     *
040     * <p>This method determines whether this request has come via the
041     * struts framework, by checking the value of the 'isStrutsRequest'
042     * request attribute. This is set on every request by the
043     * {@link com.randomnoun.common.webapp.struts.RequestProcessor}
044     * class. This tag is always empty, and therefore must always
045     * return BodyTag.SKIP_BODY
046     *
047     * @return BodyTag.SKIP_BODY
048     */
049    public int doStartTag()
050        throws javax.servlet.jsp.JspException
051    {
052        isStruts = false;
053
054        String isStrutsString = (String) pageContext.getRequest().getAttribute("isStrutsRequest");
055
056        if ("true".equals(isStrutsString)) {
057            isStruts = true;
058        }
059
060        return BodyTag.SKIP_BODY; // this tag always has an empty body.
061    }
062
063    /** doEnd tag handler required to fulfill the Tag interface defined in the
064     * <a href="http://java.sun.com/products/jsp/">JSP specification</a>.
065     *
066     * <p>This method enforces the presence of the 'isStrutsRequest' request
067     * attribute. If the attribute is present, then processing continues
068     * normally, otherwise an error message is given to the user, and the
069     * requested URL is sent to the logger of this class.
070     *
071     * <p>Note that the output of this tag is *not* internationalised.
072     *
073     * @return BodyTag.SKIP_BODY or BodyTag.SKIP_PAGE
074     */
075    public int doEndTag()
076        throws javax.servlet.jsp.JspException
077    {
078                try {
079                if (isStruts) {
080                    return BodyTag.EVAL_PAGE;
081                } else {
082                HttpServletRequest httpRequest = (HttpServletRequest)pageContext.getRequest();
083                logger.info("Attempt to access JSP directly via URL: '" + httpRequest.getRequestURL() + "'");
084                try {
085                    // try to take back anything buffered to be sent to the client
086                    pageContext.getOut().clear();
087                } catch (IOException ioe) {
088                    // swallow this exception - it's not that important if content has already been sent
089                }
090                pageContext.getOut().println("<html><body>");
091                pageContext.getOut().println("<p>Direct access to JSPs is denied by policy</p>");
092                pageContext.getOut().println("</body></html>");
093            } 
094            return BodyTag.SKIP_PAGE;
095                } catch (IOException ioe) {
096                        // may be caused by end-user hitting 'stop' button in browser; ignore
097                        return BodyTag.SKIP_PAGE;
098                } catch (Throwable t) {
099                         // log and rethrow
100                         t.printStackTrace();
101                         throw (JspException) new JspException("Exception occurred in AuthCheckTag").initCause(t);
102                }    
103        }
104}
